alert.note: Alert for Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Western Charlton (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 29 at 4:24PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southwestern Brantley, east central Ware and northwestern Charlton Counties through 500 PM EDT... At 424 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Race Pond to near Stephen Foster State Park. Movement was southwest at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Race Pond. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Brantley; Northeastern Charlton; Northern Ware; Western Charlton
